poem:
Surveillance on the Highway  

In the land of wide skies,  
where freedom falters, machines  
take note of travelers.  
Silent watchers gather names,  
binding souls to unseen chains.  
Once bright roads, now shadowed paths;  
each step, a question.  
In the dance of progress,  
escape narrows, while birds  
of promise flee the choking air.
